comment._content: Ex 25.2 is "Speak unto the children of Israel, that they bring me an offering: of every man that giveth it willingly with his heart ye shall take my offering."

comment.author: 8468254@N02
comment._content: Rhododendrons. I wonder is it Hillsboro? (Or west Cork or Achill?)

comment.author: 8468254@N02
comment._content: Hmm. Bracken, big gardens, crudely built pseudo-religious rubble. Was it Howth head?

comment.author: 39191857@N05
comment._content: Searching furiously but not doing too good yet.  I have a sense that it is up north rather than down south but I don't have any thing to support that.

comment.author: 8468254@N02
comment._content: Where else looks like that? The bottom of Slieve Donard.

comment.author: 8468254@N02
comment._content: Actually, it's very like that. There used to be a big house there, though there's nothing left now except the ice house and various follies.

comment.author: 39191857@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/8468254@N02/] the nearest well to that would appear to have been St Fintans well in Sutton but that is now gone, disappeared, destroyed!

comment.author: 8468254@N02
comment._content: I suspect somewhere up here: maps.osi.ie/publicviewer/#V1,736873,829963,6,7

comment.author: 8468254@N02
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/swordscookie] I don't think it's a spring. I think it's a mountain stream.

comment.author: 8468254@N02
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/swordscookie] Incidentally, if it is Howth, there's a load of wells in peoples' gardens around the head: maps.osi.ie/publicviewer/#V1,729576,738976,7,9. You never know what tasteless individual may have constructed such a thing.

comment.author: 20727502@N00
comment._content: I think we're in Tollymore here. It's been 22 years since I was there, so will have to search the braincells, but I think I remember some class of a well.... (Or maybe it;'s Glenariff... think think)

comment.author: 20727502@N00
comment._content: The more I think about it, I am pretty sure there is some kind of a well/shrine/thingy near "the hermitage" in Tollymore. Certainly there are other plaques and religiony stuff about the place. Maybe someone who was there more recently (than 1991) might remember?

comment.author: 8468254@N02
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/20727502@N00] That's what I reckon too, but it's a couple of years since I went up Donard and even longer since I explored the national park.

comment.author: 8468254@N02
comment._content: It also looks like just the sort of thing you'd find in St Anne's in Raheny but I'm pretty sure it's not there.

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/20727502@N00] [http://www.flickr.com/photos/8468254@N02] Re Tollymore/Tullymore - any of these jog your memory??

comment.author: 8468254@N02
comment._content: Beyond making more sure that it's there, no. I think it's near the Donard falls. You need to ask a local.

comment.author: 80878055@N00
comment._content: My Guide to Tollymore forest Park from 1955 mentions several monuments and features some of which have verses inscribed on them but nothing like this I'm afraid.

comment.author: 8468254@N02
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/fairviewdesign] Pity. You were the local I was thinking of.

comment.author: 80878055@N00
comment._content: Next time Im in the park I will keep my eye out for it - would be better still if I could get a chat with one of the rangers.

comment.author: 45618415@N05
comment._content:
Certainly not a 'Holy Well'... The verselet implies that the water is drunk for pleasure rather than devotion/healing, etc... 

The phrasing and the term 'Missionary Box' suggest the Protestant tradition rather than the Catholic tradition, IMO.

comment.author: 8468254@N02
comment._content: Seems reasonable. I'd have thought even the reference to Exodus looked a bit protestant. To the extent that I've noticed (not much, admittedly), such references as you do see on RC monuments tend to be new testament.

comment.author: 80878055@N00
comment._content: I tend to agree and this makes me think of the location being in an estate like Tollymore or elsewhere where I could envisage a female member of the family expressing such feelings.

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: The Penny Wish Limerick So wishing wells are very many This one could be almost any. A coin in the dish - A long dreamed of wish - Heaven's found spending a penny!

comment.author: 29809546@N00
comment._content:
I have no insights into location or date, but I did come across this from The Belfast News-Letter, Tuesday, September 29, 1857, in an account of the annual meeting of the Diocesan Branch of the Society for the Promotion of Christianity among the Jews (yes, really).
Mr Kronheim in the course of his address, introduced the story of a Yorkshireman, who, after attending a missionary meeting and seeing a missionary box there, he thought that he should have one to, and when he returned home, he got an old ox horn, and wrote upon it -
"This horn once grew on the head of an ox, Now it's turned into a missionary box."
(Laughter),
He had been debarred from passing round a collection plate, but finished his speech by holding up a scale and saying
"This scale is not a plate, but it is a scale, And I hope to put something therein you will not fail." (Loud laughter)

comment.author: 8468254@N02

comment.author: 39191857@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/nlireland] I think so and given it's size and the nature of the beast it may no longer exist or have been destroyed shortly after the shot was taken.  I spent several hours yesterday going through holy wells on Flickr, Google and elsewhere trying the find something useful but I suspect that it was in a garden or a park up North and is no longer with us.  And take that satisfied smile off your face young woman or your face will freeze like that:-)

comment.author: 8468254@N02
comment._content:
Checking the angles with google streetview, 2242 is definitely taken from round the Donard side - the mountain in the background is the wrong shape from anywhere else.
Anyway, in sum, I think I was close enough with the tenth post that we should deputise someone do go up there with a camera and have a look around.
